content.description: Start on the bouldery crack into the wide hands into fists roof that makes the rigatoni so delicious and saucy. This is not to be missed!
content.location: It tackles the big, obvious roof on the left side of the main wall.

content.description: What was once thought of as the food of the peasants by the Italian people is now an Italian American staple. It is now also a delicious crack. Get some! Start with a 0.5 - 0.75 laser-cut crack with feet and crimps spread all over it. Step right under the roof into a perfect hand crack, then finish up with some fun 5.8 climbing to the anchor.
content.protection: A standard desert rack with perhaps some extra 0.5s and 0.75s.
content.location:
To the right of the obvious

Rigatoni Roof

, it is the second climb to the left on the main wall and climbs the most obvious splitter on your way up.

content.description: Holy Cannoli climbs a fun roof traverse with your feet after passing the roof into a good hand crack with good protection.
content.protection: A standard desert rack roof is protected with a perfect 0.75 in the middle.
content.location: It is the first route on the climber's right and is very obvious because of the low traversing roof.

content.description: Start with easy off fingers into a chimney into some sports action with solid gear. You'll want a #6 or #5, maybe both, if you feel uncomfortable with the wide.
content.protection: A standard desert rack with a #5 or #6 or perhaps both.
content.location:
It is 10 feet left of

Holy Cannoli

and is the second to the left on the climber's right area. See the photo.

content.description: Run up the ramp, and climb up some fun movement over a flake into a hand crack finish with easy. 0.75s.
content.protection: A standard desert rack with maybe a #5 or #6 for the 5.5 ramp start.
content.location: It is easily found by the giant ramp in the middle of the main wall that you start on.

pathTokens: Gateway Vicinity aka The West End
